Method Detail

prettifyPath

public static java.lang.String prettifyPath(java.lang.String s,
                                            int l)
Adjust a long string in order to cope with space limitations. Tipically, it will be used to show long paths in the window caption.

Parameters:
s - the string to be treated
l - the total maximum length of the result

checkExtension

public static java.lang.String checkExtension(java.lang.String p,
                                              java.lang.String ext)
Check if an extension is present in a file name and, if it is not the case, add the specified extension. If the string contains " somewhere, this character is removed and the extension is not added. In this way, if the user wants to avoid the automatic extension add, he should put the file name between "'s

Parameters:
p - the file name
ext - the extension that should be added if the file name does not contain one. This extension should NOT contain the dot.
Returns:
the absolutely gorgeous file name, completed with an extension

getFileNameOnly

public static java.lang.String getFileNameOnly(java.lang.String s)
Get the file name, without extensions

Parameters:
p - the file name with path and extension to be processed

createCompleteFileName

public static java.lang.String createCompleteFileName(java.lang.String path,
                                                      java.lang.String filename)
When we have a path and a filename to put together, we need to separate them with a system file separator, being careful not to add it when it is already include in the path.

Parameters:
path - the path
filename - the file name
Returns:
the complete filename, including path

substituteBizarreChars

public static java.lang.String substituteBizarreChars(java.lang.String p,
                                                      java.util.Map bc)
Change characters which could give an error in some situations with their corresponding code, or escape sequence.

Parameters:
p - the input string, eventually containing the characters to be changed.
an - hash table in which each character to be changed is associated with its code, or escape sequence.
Returns:
the string with the characters changed.
